glsa.title: Apache 2.0: Denial of Service vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: A bug in Apache may allow a remote attacker to perform a Denial of Service attack.

background.p: The Apache HTTP Server Project is a featureful, freely-available HTTP (Web) server.

description.p: Filip Sneppe discovered that Apache improperly handles byterange requests to CGI scripts.

impact.p: A remote attacker may access vulnerable scripts in a malicious way, exhausting all RAM and swap space on the server, resulting in a Denial of Service of the Apache server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All apache users should upgrade to the latest version:
